Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, accurately showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that lacks water, depicting it as wilting or dry, demonstrating an understanding of the negative impact of no water.
The student can draw a plant that lacks light, indicating it as struggling or not growing well.
The student can identify and label most parts of the plant in their drawing, such as leaves, stems, and roots, although there might be minor labeling omissions.
The student can suggest, through their drawings, the difference over time between a plant growing in sunlight and one kept in the dark, although these differences might not be vividly detailed.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label all plant parts accurately, sometimes omitting parts like the roots or mixing up their locations *(labels may be missing or slightly misplaced)*.

The student may not clearly illustrate the complex patterns of how light and water affect plant health, potentially leading to a simplistic view without distinct progression stages or effects *(student shows isolated instances rather than continuous growth patterns)*.
